item.title: Unit Testing in Rust (or why I love Rust)
item.description: If you’ve been through the process of adding unit tests in C++ with gmock or OCaml or python you know that you at least need to create a new file, add some linking flags, import a library and trigger the test suite from code and then execute the test program separately. No wonder it takes a not so subtle code review comment to get people to start writing tests. Let’s take another use case.
